questions.text: Assertion: Malate shuttle is required for Glycolysis Reason: In Gluconeogenesis, NADH is transported from mitochondria to cytoplasm

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both are correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both are correct but R is not explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are incorrect

questions.correct_answer: B. A and R both are correct but R is not explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. B) A and R both are correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy presents to the emergency room after having a generalized tonic-clonic seizure. The child has a history of epilepsy, ataxia, and lactic acidosis. When questioned, the parents state that their child was born with a rare metabolic disease, pyruvate carboxylase deficiency. Which one of the following metabolites is this child unable to produce effectively?
Which one of the following statements concerning glycolysis is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Hexokinase is important in hepatic glucose metabolism only in the absorptive period following consumption of a carbohydrate-containing meal.

options.label: B
options.text: Fructose 2,6-Bisphosphate is a potent inhibitor of phosphofructokinase.

options.label: C
options.text: The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.

options.label: D
options.text: The conversion of glucose to lactate yields two ATP and two NADH.

questions.correct_answer: C. The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.

questions.text: Which one of following statements about glycolysis and gluconeogenesis is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: All the reactions of glycolysis are freely reversible for gluconeogenesis.

options.label: B
options.text: Glycolysis can proceed in the absence of oxygen only if pyruvate is formed from lactate in muscle.

options.label: C
options.text: Red blood cells only metabolize glucose by anaerobic glycolysis (and the pentose phosphate pathway).

options.label: D
options.text: The reverse of glycolysis is the pathway for gluconeogenesis in skeletal muscle.

questions.correct_answer: C. Red blood cells only metabolize glucose by anaerobic glycolysis (and the pentose phosphate pathway).
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Red blood cells only metabolize glucose by anaerobic glycolysis (and the pentose phosphate pathway).

questions.text: A student takes some tablets she is offered at a disco, and without asking what they are she swallows them. A short time later she starts to hyperventilate and becomes very hot. What is the most likely action of the tablets she has taken?

options.label: A
options.text: An inhibitor of mitochondrial ATP synthesis

options.label: B
options.text: An inhibitor of the transport of ADP into mitochondria to be phosphorylated

options.label: C
options.text: An inhibitor of the transport of ATP out of mitochondria into the cytosol

options.label: D
options.text: An uncoupler of mitochondrial electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation

questions.correct_answer: D. An uncoupler of mitochondrial electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) An uncoupler of mitochondrial electron transport and oxidative phosphorylation

questions.text: A 68-year-old man with Parkinson’s disease is undergoing experimental treatment with a drug that partially inhibits Complex III of the mitochondrial electron transport chain. Which of the following is the most likely effect of this drug on mitochondrial function?

options.label: A
options.text: ATP synthesis is reduced due to decreased proton pumping, as Complex III normally translocate 2 H⁺ ions per electron pair.

options.label: B
options.text: Complex II compensates for the loss by increasing proton pumping across the inner mitochondrial membrane.

options.label: C
options.text: The proton gradient is diminished because Complex III typically translocates 4 H⁺ ions per electron pair.

options.label: D
options.text: There is no effect on the proton gradient, as Complex III does not participate in proton translocation.

questions.correct_answer: C. The proton gradient is diminished because Complex III typically translocates 4 H⁺ ions per electron pair.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The proton gradient is diminished because Complex III typically translocates 4 H⁺ ions per electron pair.

questions.text: A 33-year-old man presented with symptoms of weakness, fatigue, shortness of breath, and dizziness. His hemoglobin level was less than 7 g/dl (normal for male being greater than 13.5 g/dl). Red blood cells isolated from patient showed abnormally low level of lactate production. A deficiency of which one of the following enzymes would be the most likely cause of this patient’s anemia?

A 4-year-old boy of middle eastern ancestry is known to have inherited favism, a sensitivity to fava beans due to glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency. Which of the following indicates the primary pathway affected by this deficiency and the pathway secondarily affected?

options.label: B
options.text: Pentose phosphate pathway, Fatty acid oxidation

options.label: C
options.text: Citric acid cycle, Pentose phosphate pathway

questions.correct_answer: A. Pentose phosphate pathway, Cholesterol synthesis
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Pentose phosphate pathway, Cholesterol synthesis

questions.text: A 50-year-old patient with a recent diagnosis of lung cancer is undergoing metabolic testing to better understand the biochemical environment of their tumor. The oncologist is specifically interested in the altered metabolic pathways commonly associated with cancer cells. During evaluation, it is found that the cancer cells in the patient's tumor are primarily using glucose to produce lactate even in the presence of oxygen. The oncologist suspects that this alteration in metabolism is influencing the growth and survival of the tumor. Which of the following statements about this altered metabolic pathway is most accurate?

options.label: B
options.text: It is a form of aerobic glycolysis with lactate formation

options.label: C
options.text: It results in the production of more ATP compared to normal cellular respiration

options.label: D
options.text: It leads to decreased glucose uptake by the cancer cells

questions.correct_answer: B. It is a form of aerobic glycolysis with lactate formation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It is a form of aerobic glycolysis with lactate formation

questions.text: A neonate presents with metabolic acidosis, tachypnea, and poor feeding shortly after birth. Blood tests reveal elevated levels of lactate and pyruvate, with a high lactate-to-pyruvate ratio. Which of the following enzyme deficiencies is the most likely cause?
The enzymes that convert pyruvate to acetyl CoA are given in the diagram. What are the enzymes marked as E1 and E2 respectively?
questions.correct_answer: A. Pyruvate dehydrogenase and dihydrolipoyl transacetylase
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Pyruvate dehydrogenase and dihydrolipoyl transacetylase

questions.text: A 22-year-old medical student is studying for a biochemistry exam on carbohydrate metabolism. During the exam, she is presented with a diagram showing the regulation of glycogen metabolism in the liver. The diagram demonstrates that molecule B promotes glycogenolysis (glycogen breakdown) by activating glycogen phosphorylase and inhibiting glycogen synthase, while molecule A promotes glycogenesis (glycogen synthesis) by activating glycogen synthase and inhibiting glycogen phosphorylase. Based on the diagram and the clinical scenario, which option correctly identifies regulatory molecules A and B?
Which reaction in the figure below occurs in both muscle and liver but has substantially different qualities in the two?

A 6-months old child presented with fasting hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly, growth retardation. On liver biopsy, abnormal glycogen was accumulated in liver. Once this child reached puberty, he no longer has hypoglycemia, muscle weakness, hepatomegaly. He reached normal adult height also. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 3-year-old boy presents to the outpatient clinic with a swollen abdomen and failure to thrive. On examination, his liver is palpable 4 cm below the right costal margin, and he has a doll-like face with chubby cheeks. Laboratory investigations reveal fasting hypoglycemia, lactic acidosis, and hyperuricemia. Kidneys are enlarged but no splenomegaly. A liver biopsy demonstrates increased glycogen storage with normal structure. Which enzyme deficiency is most likely responsible for this patient's clinical presentation?
Identify the heteropolysaccharide from the disaccharide repeat unit given in the picture.

A 3-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with a notably protruding abdomen, an umbilical hernia, coarse facial features, corneal clouding, intellectual disability, and short stature. Based on these clinical features, what is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-month-old infant, who was experiencing seizures, was diagnosed with a GLUT1 deficiency, resulting in reduced glucose uptake into the brain. As a result, which one of the following substrates was providing energy for the brain?

A 2-month-old male infant is brought to the pediatrician by his parents with concerns of feeding difficulties, vomiting after milk feeds, and poor weight gain. On examination, the child is underweight for his age, has a distended abdomen, and hepatomegaly is noted on palpation. Ophthalmologic evaluation reveals bilateral lenticular opacities suggestive of cataracts. Laboratory investigations show elevated liver transaminases and reducing substances in the urine, but the urine is negative for glucose. Further biochemical evaluation and clinical history raise suspicion for a disorder of galactose metabolism. Which of the following enzyme deficiencies is least likely to be responsible for this child’s presentation?

Routine examination of the urine of an asymptomatic patient showed a positive reaction with benedict test (a copper reduction method of detecting reducing sugars) but a negative reaction with the glucose oxidase test. Which one of the following sugars is least likely to be present (assuming a single elevated saccharide)?

A researcher is studying urinary metabolites in a patient after exposure to a detoxified compound. The compound is found conjugated with glucaric acid. Glucaric acid is a metabolite of glucose that is formed through which of the following processes?

options.label: D
options.text: Oxidation of both aldehyde carbon and primary alcoholic group

questions.correct_answer: D. Oxidation of both aldehyde carbon and primary alcoholic group
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Oxidation of both aldehyde carbon and primary alcoholic group

questions.text: Which of the following metabolic intermediate involved in glycolysis, gluconeogenesis and glycogenolysis?

A 22-year-old soldier collapses from dehydration during maneuvers in the desert and is sent to a military hospital. Prior to enlisting, a physician observed a high level of glucose in his urine during an examination. At first, he was not allowed to enlist because he was suspected of having diabetes. However, further tests determined that his insulin level was normal. A glucose tolerance test exhibited a normal pattern. Laboratory tests following his dehydration episode repeat the previous findings, but further testing of the urine reveals that only d-glucose is elevated. Other sugars were not elevated. This patient's elevated urinary glucose and his dehydration episode are caused by a deficiency in which of the following?

A 25-year-old male presents with anemia and is suspected of having a red blood cell (RBC) enzymatic defect. You are evaluating the metabolic capacity of mature RBCs. Which of the following enzymes or components would NOT be found in mature RBCs?
Assertion: Inulin like fructans are used as probiotics as they are non digestable Reason: Resistance to digestion in the upper GI tract results from. Beta configuration of anomeric C2

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both are correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both are correct but R is not explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are incorrect

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both are correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A and R both are correct and R is explanation of A

questions.text: A fifty-year-old man with type 1 diabetes is referred to an ophthalmologist for evaluation of developing cataract. Which of the following enzymes is most strongly associated with cataract formation in this patient?

A 90kg man, after eating which enzyme/intermediate will be active causing weight gain? 1. Malonyl CoA 2. Acetyl CoA carboxylase 3. Mitochondrial carnitine transporter 4. Tricarboxylate transporter (citrate)

A 6-year-old child was brought to the clinic with complaints of recurrent episodes of abdominal discomfort. On clinical examination, multiple eruptive xanthomas were noted on the skin. A fasting blood sample revealed turbid, creamy plasma. Which lipoprotein is most likely to be elevated in this patient?
A 25-year-old patient presents with p extremely low levels of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, orange tonsils, and peripheral neuropathy. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 6-months old boy was hospitalized following a seizure. History revealed that for several days prior, his appetite was decreased due to a "stomach virus". At admission, his blood glucose was 24 mg/dl (age-referenced normal is 60-100). His urine was negative for ketone bodies, but positive for a variety of dicarboxylic acids. A tentative diagnosis of medium-chain fatty acyl CoA dehydrogenase (MCAD) deficiency is made. In patients with MCAD deficiency, the fasting hypoglycemia is a consequence of:

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased ability to convert acetyl CoA to glucose

options.label: C
options.text: Increased conversion of acetyl CoA to acetoacetate

options.label: D
options.text: Increased production of ATP and NADH

questions.text: A 28-year-old previously healthy mountaineer is rescued after being stranded for 6 days in a remote area following an avalanche that separated him from his expedition team. He had minimal food supplies and rationed a small amount of trail mix over the first 3 days before completely running out. On examination, he is alert but weak, with significant weight loss. His vital signs show mild hypotension and bradycardia. A urine sample is collected as part of his initial assessment and subjected to Rothera's test, which shows a purple ring at the interface as seen in the image. Which metabolic adaptation best explains these findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased glycogenolysis to maintain blood glucose levels

options.label: B
options.text: Enhanced ketogenesis from fatty acid oxidation to provide alternative fuel for the brain

options.label: C
options.text: Increased proteolysis with urinary nitrogen excretion from muscle breakdown

options.label: D
options.text: Activation of the pentose phosphate pathway to generate NADPH for fatty acid synthesis

questions.correct_answer: B. Enhanced ketogenesis from fatty acid oxidation to provide alternative fuel for the brain
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Enhanced ketogenesis from fatty acid oxidation to provide alternative fuel for the brain

questions.text: In beta oxidation of palmitic acid, if final product is acetoacetate then net gain of ATP is:

A 45-year-old patient with familial hypercholesterolemia is started on a medication that competitively inhibits an enzyme involved in both cholesterol synthesis and ketone body formation. Which enzyme is most likely being targeted by this medication?

A 2-year-old child with eczema and growth retardation is found to have a deficiency in dietary essential fatty acids. His diet lacks seeds, nuts, and vegetable oils. This deficiency impairs the synthesis of arachidonic acid, an important precursor of prostaglandins and leukotrienes. Which of the following best describes the biosynthetic pathway leading to synthesis of arachidonic acid in mammals?

options.label: B
options.text: Chain elongation and one desaturation of linolenic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

questions.correct_answer: C. Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman with a family history of premature cardiovascular disease presents for evaluation. Her lipid profile shows low HDL levels and mildly elevated total cholesterol. Genetic analysis reveals a rare mutation that reduces the activity of lecithin:cholesterol acyltransferase (LCAT). This enzyme is crucial for the maturation of HDL particles. Which apolipoprotein primarily serves as an activator of this enzyme and is likely dysfunctional in this patient?

A 36-year-old male with a sedentary lifestyle presents for a routine checkup. His diet history reveals that he consumes large amounts of refined carbohydrates and avoids fats completely, believing it to be a healthy practice. Despite his low-fat intake, he has gained 8 kg over the past 6 months. His fasting blood tests reveal elevated serum triglycerides. Physical examination is unremarkable. Which lipoprotein is most likely elevated in his blood due to his current dietary pattern?
Which protein, having structural homology with plasminogen, is responsible for myocardial infarction and stroke?

Assertion: Acetoacetate, Beta hydroxybutyrate, Acetone are compounds termed as ketone bodies. Liver is an organ which can synthesize ketone body but cannot utilize ketone bodies. Reason: All enzymes for ketone body synthesis are present in liver mitochondria

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both are correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both are correct but R is not explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are incorrect

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both are correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A and R both are correct and R is not explanation of A

questions.text: Niemann-Pick disease, like other neurolipidoses, present in infancy or childhood with plateauing of development and neurologic regression. The accumulating substance is a phospholipid made in which of the following steps in the figure below?
Hormone sensitive lipase is inhibited by:

A premature infant presents with hepatomegaly, cardiac dilation, and elevated liver enzymes. A defect in long-chain fatty acid β-oxidation is suspected. Which of the following enzymes are sequentially involved in this pathway?
Child presents with hypotonia and seizures. It was confirmed to be Zellweger syndrome. Which among the following accumulates in brain in this condition?
In the given glycine titration curve, calculate or identify the pH at which molecules exist in a zwitter ion form.

A 62-year-old male with CAD comes to the physician for a follow-up examination. His blood pressure is 130/80 mmHg, height is 182 cm, weight is 85 kg, and BMI is 25 kg/m. Serum studies shows a glucose concentration of 95 mg/dL and homocysteine concentration of 19.3 µmol/L (N=5-15). Serum lipid concentrations are within the normal range. Which of the following enzyme deficiencies is most likely to be found in this patient?

Because of the close interrelationship between the vitamins, patients with deficiencies of either folate or vitamin B12 exhibit similar symptoms. Which of the following tests would best help distinguish between a folate and vitamin B12 deficiency?

A biochemist is doing experiment on a protein to determine the amino acid sequence. While experiment mutation occurred and mutated protein acquired increased tendency to be phosphorylated, in this protein alanine is replaced by which amino acid?

A young individual presents with a triad of symptoms: chronic diarrhea, cognitive disturbances, and a photosensitive rash localized around the neck and exposed areas, resembling a necklace. Genetic analysis indicates an autosomal recessive disorder affecting neutral amino acid transport. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A middle-aged individual presents with chronic diarrhea, cognitive decline, and a well-demarcated photosensitive rash around the neck resembling a necklace. Laboratory testing reveals a significantly elevated 24-hour urinary 5-hydroxyindoleacetic acid (5-HIAA) level. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Niacin deficiency due to inadequate dietary intake

options.label: C
options.text: Hartnup disorder leading to impaired amino acid transport

options.label: D
options.text: Carcinoid syndrome with excessive serotonin production

questions.correct_answer: D. Carcinoid syndrome with excessive serotonin production
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Carcinoid syndrome with excessive serotonin production

questions.text: A researcher is analyzing a novel peptide hormone isolated from a tumor biopsy. To determine its precise molecular weight and deduce the sequence of its amino acids, she selects a technique that can offer both qualitative and quantitative data on the peptide’s composition and structure. Which of the following methods is most suitable for this purpose?
A biochemistry professor is testing students on the metabolic fates of amino acids. Which of the following amino acid-to-product relationships is incorrectly matched?

During morning rounds in the metabolic disorders unit, you review a case of a 7-year-old patient presenting with hyperammonemia. The attending physician asks which enzyme involved in nitrogen metabolism has the unique ability to function with either NAD+ or NADP+ as cofactors, potentially allowing it to adapt to different metabolic conditions.

A child with a large head, multiple fractures, and blue scleras (whites of the eyes) is evaluated for osteogenesis imperfecta. One study involves labeling of collagen chains in tissue culture to assess their mobility by gel electrophoresis. Amino acids labeled with radioactive carbon 14 are added to the culture dishes in order to label collagen. Which of the following amino acids would not result in labeled collagen?
One important function of nitric oxide (NO) is the induction of vascular smooth muscle relaxation in response to acetylcholine. The production of (NO) requires which amino acid?

A mother has brought her 3-month-old baby to the paediatrician and indicates that the infant is lethargic and has poor suckling and seems uninterested in eating. In addition, the mother notes that the baby’s diapers often smell like burnt sugar. This infant likely has a defect in which of the following enzymes?
Which of the following would have no effect on the function of the protein product?
Which of the following analytical techniques does not primarily provide information about the three-dimensional structural arrangement or Amino acid sequence of proteins?
In this transamination reaction (right), which of the following are the products X and Y?

A 2-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with episodes of vomiting, lethargy, and irritability that seem to occur after protein-rich meals. Initial laboratory tests reveal elevated ammonia levels. The medical team suspects a urea cycle disorder and orders additional metabolic testing. If this patient has a mutation in ornithine transcarboxylase (OTC), which of the following measurable abnormalities would be most characteristic of this specific enzymatic defect?

options.label: B
options.text: Elevated urinary excretion of argininosuccinic acid

questions.correct_answer: C. Elevation in blood orotic acid
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Elevation in blood orotic acid

questions.text: A 3-day-old neonate presents with poor feeding, lethargy, vomiting, and episodes of apnea. Laboratory studies reveal a markedly elevated plasma ammonia level. Genetic testing confirms a urea cycle disorder. The patient is started on dietary protein restriction along with pharmacologic treatment. One of the agents administered conjugates with glycine to form hippuric acid, which is excreted in the urine, thereby facilitating nitrogen disposal. Which of the following agents was most likely given to this patient?

A 58-year-old patient presents to the emergency department with chest pain. The physician orders cardiac biomarker tests to determine if the patient has suffered a myocardial infarction. The lab report shows elevated levels of LDH 1. These tests rely on the identification of specific isoenzymes. Which of the following statements is correct regarding isoenzymes?

options.label: A
options.text: Isoenzymes work at identical rates, catalyze identical reactions, and have identical kinetic properties

options.label: B
options.text: Isoenzymes always share the same quaternary structure

options.label: C
options.text: Isoenzymes belong to the same enzyme classification group

options.label: D
options.text: Isoenzymes have similar tissue distribution patterns

questions.correct_answer: C. Isoenzymes belong to the same enzyme classification group
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Isoenzymes belong to the same enzyme classification group

questions.text: Identify the type of Inhibition shown in the graph.
Digestive enzymes are?
Which one of the following is a cofactor and not a coenzyme?
The enzyme catalyzing this reaction belongs to which class of enzyme?

A 48-year-old male with excessive drinking over an extended period of time while eating poorly, admitted to the hospital with “high out- put” heart failure. Which of the following enzymes is most likely inhibited?
Thiamine level is best monitored by –
Biological role of metallothionein is to sequester harmful metal ions. These bind to?
A buffer that is most effective at pH of about 8.3 is: -
In a diabetic patient

options.label: A
options.text: RQ decreases and on administration of insulin RQ increases

options.label: B
options.text: RQ increases and on administration of insulin RQ decreases

options.label: C
options.text: No effect of insulin on RQ

options.label: D
options.text: No effect of diabetes on RQ

questions.correct_answer: A. RQ decreases and on administration of insulin RQ increases
questions.explanation: Ans. A) RQ decreases and on administration of insulin RQ increases

questions.text: A patient presented with triad of angular stomatitis, corneal vascularization and glossitis with magenta coloured tongue is probably a case of:
Condition shown in Image is due to deficiency of?

A 2-year-old child was brought to his pediatrician for evaluation of gastrointestinal problems. The parents report that the boy has been listless for the last few weeks. Lab tests reveal a microcytic, hypochromic anemia. Blood lead levels are elevated. Which of the enzymes listed below is most likely to have higher-than-normal activity in the liver of this child?

A 2-year-old boy presents with developmental delay, brittle hair, and frequent fractures. On physical examination, the child has loose skin and joint hypermobility. The physician suspects a genetic condition affecting copper metabolism, leading to reduced activity of lysyl oxidase, an enzyme essential for crosslinking collagen and elastin. Laboratory tests reveal low serum copper and ceruloplasmin levels. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old male presents to the emergency department with confusion, diaphoresis, and tremors. He reports having completed an intense 2-hour workout earlier in the day but skipped his post-workout meal. Later that evening, he attended a party where he consumed several alcoholic drinks on an empty stomach. His blood glucose is 52 mg/dL. Which of the following metabolic processes is most significantly inhibited by alcohol consumption, potentially contributing to this patient's hypoglycemia?

A researcher is developing a therapeutic strategy for Huntington's disease using small interfering RNAs (siRNAs) to reduce the production of mutant huntingtin protein. These molecules bind to specific mRNA sequences and trigger their degradation, reducing protein synthesis without altering the DNA. What is the mechanism underlying this therapeutic approach?
questions.correct_answer: A. Gene knockdown via RNA interference
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Gene knockdown via RNA interference

questions.text: In the following partial sequence of mRNA, a mutation of the template DNA results in a change in codon 91 to UAA. What type of mutation is it?
Taql is a restriction endonuclease commonly used to cut human DNA into pieces before inserting it into plasmid. Which of the following is most likely to be the recognition sequence for this enzymes.

A lethal mutation occurs in a bacterium, rendering it incapable of replicating its chromosome. Because of this mutation, DNA synthesis produces many short fragments of DNA that have RNA sequences at their 5’ ends. The mutation is most likely in a gene
Disorders resulting from defects in nucleotide excision repair include all of the following, except:

A 10-year-old girl is brought by her parents to the dermatologist. She has many freckles on her face, neck, arms, and hands, and the parents report that she is unusually sensitive to sunlight. Two basal cell carcinomas are identified on her face. Based on the clinical picture, which of the following processes is most likely to be defective in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Repair of double-strand breaks by error-prone homologous recombination

options.label: B
options.text: Removal of mismatched bases from the 3′-end of Okazaki fragments by a methyl-directed process

options.label: C
options.text: Removal of pyrimidine dimers from DNA by nucleotide excision repair

options.label: D
options.text: Removal of uracil from DNA by base excision repair

questions.correct_answer: C. Removal of pyrimidine dimers from DNA by nucleotide excision repair
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Removal of pyrimidine dimers from DNA by nucleotide excision repair

questions.text: Apo B48, B100 belongs to same RNA, difference between them is due to ?
Which of the following is true about 'Wobble hypothesis':

options.label: A
options.text: Each amino acid is represented by only one codon

options.label: B
options.text: Base in third position of codon has reduced specificity for the same amino acid

options.label: C
options.text: Actively transported sugars are usually hexoses

options.label: D
options.text: Surface tension lowering substances get concentrated at interface

questions.correct_answer: B. Base in third position of codon has reduced specificity for the same amino acid
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Base in third position of codon has reduced specificity for the same amino acid

questions.text: In the genetic code of human nuclear DNA one of the codons specifying the amino acid tyrosine is UAC. Another codon specifying the same amino acid is?
If a 4 nucleotide sequence codes for an amino acid instead of 3, then theoretically how many unique amino acids could be coded by such a system?
The rate of DNA synthesis in a culture of cells could be most accurately determined by measuring the incorporation of which of the following radioactive compounds?
The gaps between segments of DNA on the lagging strand produced by restriction enzymes are rejoined / sealed by:

Telomeres are complexes of DNA and protein that protect the ends of linear chromosomes. In most normal human somatic cells, telomeres shorten with each division, in stem cells and in cancer cells, however, telomeric length is maintained. In the synthesis of telomeres:

options.label: A
options.text: Telomerase, a ribonucleoprotein, provides both the RNA and the polymerase needed for synthesis.

options.label: B
options.text: The RNA of telomerase serves as a primer.

options.label: C
options.text: The polymerase of telomerase is a DNA-directed DNA polymerase.

questions.correct_answer: A. Telomerase, a ribonucleoprotein, provides both the RNA and the polymerase needed for synthesis.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Telomerase, a ribonucleoprotein, provides both the RNA and the polymerase needed for synthesis.

questions.text: A 20-year-old anemic man was found to have an abnormal form of beta-globin chain that is 172 amino acid long rather than the 141 found in normal protein. Which of the following point mutation is consistent with this abnormality?
Which of the following is true about mitochondrial DNA

options.label: B
options.text: On lagging strand Okazaki Fragments are synthesized as RNA

options.label: C
options.text: Primer is excised in much the same way as the primers in the nucleus

questions.text: A 42-year-old patient presents with persistent fever, chills, and a productive cough. Blood cultures grow gram-negative bacilli, and the infectious disease specialist is considering treatment with an antibiotic that targets bacterial protein synthesis. Which of the following bacterial mRNA elements would be most relevant as a potential novel drug target for inhibiting bacterial translation initiation without affecting human protein synthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: The Shine-Dalgarno sequence located near the AUG start codon

options.label: B
options.text: The poly-A tail at the 3' end of the transcript

options.label: C
options.text: The 5' cap structure of the mRNA

questions.correct_answer: A. The Shine-Dalgarno sequence located near the AUG start codon
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The Shine-Dalgarno sequence located near the AUG start codon.

questions.text: During the process of protein synthesis, the factor eEF-2 induces the hydrolysis of GTP. The energy of this hydrolysis is coupled to which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Amino acid activation by attachment to a tRNA

options.label: B
options.text: Correct alignment of the mRNA on the 40S ribosome

questions.text: Assertion: The hydrolytic step leading to the release of a polypeptide chain from a ribosome is catalyzed by Release factors Reason: Release factors recognize Stop codons

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.text: After how many cycles of PCR we get half the copies of that after 26 cycles:

A 4-year-old child presents with fever, cough, and respiratory distress. The patient was admitted to the pediatric intensive care unit with suspected respiratory viral infection. The attending physician orders a respiratory viral panel using SYBR Green Dye. In which of the following diagnostic test this dye is used to detect and quantify viral nucleic acids?

The production of mRNA in eukaryotic cells requires a large number of steps, and drugs targeted to any of these steps could block mRNA production. Which one of the following accurately describes a part of the process of producing mRNA from a eukaryotic gene?

options.label: A
options.text: The sense strand of DNA is the strand used by RNA polymerase during transcription.

options.label: B
options.text: The antisense DNA strand is identical to the RNA transcript except that the DNA strand contains thymine and the RNA strand contains uracil.

options.label: C
options.text: The first RNA form produced contains both intron and exon sequences.

options.label: D
options.text: Mature mRNA contains a cap at the 5′-end, a poly (A) tail at the 3′ end, introns, and exons.

questions.correct_answer: C. The first RNA form produced contains both intron and exon sequences.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The first RNA form produced contains both intron and exon sequences

questions.text: The sequence of the template DNA strand is 5'- GATATC-3'. What will be the sequence of RNA produced?

A 60-year-old male patient with colorectal cancer is found to have hypermethylation of the promoter region of the MLH1 gene, a DNA mismatch repair gene. What is the most likely molecular consequence of this epigenetic change?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced expression of MLH1 due to promoter silencing

options.label: B
options.text: Increased DNA replication due to open chromatin structure

options.label: C
options.text: Enhanced transcription of MLH1 through increased RNA polymerase binding

options.label: D
options.text: Activation of MLH1 via histone acetylation at promoter

questions.correct_answer: A. Reduced expression of MLH1 due to promoter silencing
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Reduced expression of MLH1 due to promoter silencing

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient with aggressive diffuse large B-cell lymphoma is being considered for epigenetic therapy with a histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor. Which of the following best describes the mechanism by which HDAC inhibitors exert their therapeutic effect?

options.label: A
options.text: They prevent removal of acetyl groups from histones, maintaining open chromatin structure and allowing expression of tumor suppressor genes

options.label: B
options.text: They enhance histone methylation, leading to gene silencing and reduced cancer cell proliferation

options.label: C
options.text: They directly bind to and inhibit oncogenic transcription factors

options.label: D
options.text: They promote DNA methylation at CpG islands, silencing proto-oncogenes

questions.correct_answer: A. They prevent removal of acetyl groups from histones, maintaining open chromatin structure and allowing expression of tumor suppressor genes
questions.explanation: Ans. A) They prevent removal of acetyl groups from histones, maintaining open chromatin structure and allowing expression of tumor suppressor genes

questions.text: Which of the following can alter the gene expression by Reversible, Heritable, Chemical modifications of DNA or Histone without change in nucleotide sequence?
Oligomer with a mutant base substitution is used in?
